overview: Hired for my expertise in mobile development, I helped the company migrate their public facing mobile app from a Cordova based product to Xamarin Forms. details:
Hired for my expertise in mobile development, I helped the company migrate their public facing mobile app from a Cordova based product to Xamarin Forms. I was responsible for architecting the app’s structure and providing the team and stakeholders with valuable insight into mobile design best practice.

Following on from the conclusion of this project, my work has focused on redevelopment of the comapny's public facing website and its accompanying back end systems. Moving the website to an Angular front-end for increased speed and completelty overhauling the UI.

overview: Brought into the company as their only mobile developer, it was my responsibility to design and build a proof-of-concept application designed for electors to manage their registrations on the Electoral Roll.
details:
Brought into the company as their only mobile developer, it was my responsibility to design and build a proof-of-concept application designed for electors to manage their registrations on the Electoral Roll. I was under a little pressure from the start, as a rough version of the app was required within 6 weeks of starting for demonstration at an annual tradeshow.

Building the application in Xamarin Android with a Portable Class Library (PCL) allowed me to quickly iterate and provide a working demo with push notifications in time for the opening day. Using a PCL with MVVM architecture allowed us to quickly build out the iOS version of the application too, as only the UI needed to be implemented.

Despite being provided full automony over the product, the role was 100% remote, with the other members of the team on the other side of the country. I found the isolation to be too much and decided, a role which was a little more office based was more suited to me.

overview: As a member of the SmartShop project I was part of a team developing Windows and Xamarin (Forms & Native) apps to provide support functions for their new in-store Scan & Go service. As well as building apps, the role included providing support to the other mobile app devs, pair programming to fix bugs and helping build features on both the native iOS and Android apps; working on site (in stores) deploying hardware and software; and assisting customers with the initial on-boarding process.
